title: Kindred Passive Tooltip Fix
body:
> "Gaining a kill or assist on that target permanently empowers Kindred's attacks, granting them 1.25% of the target's _**current**_ Health in bonus physical damage."

To proc this the target needs to die. The target will have 0 health. After intense calculations, this means that you will always gain 0 bonus ad according to the tooltip. Probably not the functionality or what happens, but could the clarity maybe be improved a little bit?

replies.body: Ah, I can see how that's confusingly worded, will pass that feedback on to the Kindred team. What actually happens is that, if they kill a marked enemy, the Kindred get +1.25% current health damage on future auto attacks (so calculated off the target of those attacks at the time, Blade of the Ruined King style).

so essentially after a kill/assist kindred gets 1.25/ 2.50/3.75/ 5 and so on so with this logic will all autos keep this % damage or will i need to mark other people for this? another question i have is this potentially limitless? and one more can we potentially mark monsters? i believe i saw a few images of this happening but the context is still shaky. thanks for another awsome champ this ones so unique i love it

Yes, once you've killed a marked target all your future auto attacks will deal % current health damage to their targets. Monsters get marked occasionally by Wolf, until you've completed 6 hunts. Damage from Mark of the Kindred is uncapped, so in an infinitely long game you could get infinite damage. In reality though given the CD on the Mark and the way you need to kill a specific pre selected target you won't normally be able to get as crazy late game as Veigar or Nasus frequently do.

Ok, I think I got it. You basically get "one stack" each time you kill a marked enemy champion, where each stack gives you a botrk-like on-hit damage scaling on enemy max HP.
So basically
1 stack: 1.25% max HP bonus damage on each AA
2 stacks: 2.5% max HP bonus damage on each AA
5 stacks: 6.25% max HP bonus damage on each AA
10 stacks: 12.5% max HP bonus damage on each AA
20 stacks: 25% max HP bonus damage on each AA
...

Am i right? 

(at first i thought the bonus damage you got depended on the amount of HP the enemy champ had when you killed him. I think the wording is not really clear, do you want suggestions on how to rephrase it?)

judging by what i saw on the PBE, that is indeed correct. at 5 stacks, they will have 6.25%

So it doesn't seem like it'll be SUPER broken, they probably won't ever get to 20 stacks, and rarely 10.

It seems to be infinitely scaling, which is unprecedented with % health damage.

Which is why I'm screaming internally right now
imagine a super good late game thats like a hour long and you get to like 50% stacks hard but not impossible

It is however **current** health damage so while she may get a good early punch, the damage is going to go down as the fight goes on. Most importantly though, it's **physical** damage and on a kit that has no ap scalings and no other damage type but physical. Further, it requires a them to specifically target a person and unless they always hunt the same person, that damage isn't going to get all that high.

It's a stacking passive that requires a lot of work, a lot more work than any of the current infinitely stacking passives.

from the wiki:
>WOLF - ENEMY MONSTERS: Wolf will select a random monster within the enemy's jungle, excluding epic monsters. Once consumed, Wolf will not mark another monster for 90 seconds and can only consume marks from 6 monsters per game.

interesting and good to know tho it does make me rethink if kindred would need to stay in the jungle like skarner or if they could actually lane many thanks

p.s, i did read a thing meddler talked about with how the passive works, how it wont be in combat and does need time to activate tho i think it should be a bit quicker tbh as is you'd need to mark from blue before starting the camp then go to lane before the mark would be viable

I still don't get it, sorry :(

Could you make an example? Say her enemy has 3k max HP, and he's down at 150hp. Kindred has 200AD, and kills her (his? its? their?) opponent with an autoattack. How much damage does she gain? Also, is it on-hit damage or flat AD? Why does the passive state the bonus damage as %?

Sorry for the stupid question ^^'

When she kills a marked target, her auto-attacks gain a stack of Mark of the Kindred.
Whenever she AAs, she deals bonus damage equal to (1.25 * MotK stacks) % of her current target's current HP.
